intro: Mesembryanthemum candidissimum, commonly known as the white mesem, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, which is characterized by its succulent leaves and showy flowers. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in spring and summer. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Its fleshy leaves and drought tolerance make it well adapted to arid environments.
